data_formats: Static content (e.g. textual, reports on website pages, tables and graphs, PDF files)
digitaf_data_wp: WP2 - Tools for practitioners and farm advisors
WP4 - LL and a common AF toolbox
name: Suitable tree and shrub species for agroforestry use in Finland
description:
To help Finnish farmers exploring agroforestry, Juha Ujula and Iiris Mattila created a tree suitability database. This dataset, born from a book project (Mattila 2023) that gathered information on the possibilities for agroforestry in Finland, enables users to identify tree species adapted to the climatic conditions in Finland. The database allows farmers to align tree selection with their specific goals, such as producing timber, fruit, animal feed, or biomass, and enhancing ecosystem services. It draws on existing literature about Finnish tree species, providing details on potential products, applications like grazing or windbreaks, soil preferences, tree dimensions, light requirements, and suitability across Finland's climate zones.

The dataset is available in Appendix 1 of the book: Mattila, I. (2023). Puustoinen maatalous Suomessa - opas suunnitteluun, katsaus kulttuurinmuutokseen.  (p. 163). Kilpiän tila. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8418298
data_contact: Juha Ujala: LIVIA Ammattiopisto, Iiris Mattila: Kilpiä farm
spatial_details: The dataset shows suitability of tree species in Finnish climate zones (I-VIII, ranging from temperate to sub-arctic)
access_barrier: No, direct download/access through a web link
documentation_list: Mattila, I. (2023). Puustoinen maatalous Suomessa - opas suunnitteluun, katsaus kulttuurinmuutokseen. (p. 163). Kilpiän tila. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8418298
digitaf_data_used: The dataset feeds in to the Finnish Tree Suitability tool which is part of the AgroforesTreeAdvice tool
feedback_data_info: The dataset is available as Appendix 1 "Agroforestry puulajiluettelo" in the book Mattila, I. (2023). Puustoinen maatalous Suomessa - opas suunnitteluun, katsaus kulttuurinmuutokseen. (p. 163). Kilpiän tila. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8418298
